commit_message:
Fix manila-tempest-*-centos-7 jobs

There was a recent change announced on the CentOS
mailing lists [1] regarding housing centos-release-SIG
repos for CPU architectures other than x86_64. We rely on
centos-release-pike within our test jobs and the
repo centos-qemu-ev is found under [2].

There is now a YUM variable called $contentdir
which determines where the repos may be, and this
variable isn't set in the base images.

With $contentdir set, the URLs resolve correctly
within /etc/yum.repos.d/CentOS-QEMU-EV.repo.

See corresponding fixes for kolla [3] and
tripleo-quickstart-extras [4]

[1] https://lists.centos.org/pipermail/centos-devel/2018-March/016542.html
[2] http://mirror.centos.org/centos/7/virt/x86_64/kvm-common
[3] Ieb26c0aa65ba3ec1a45a33f87f670e5ecb782f82
[4] I6279bd4088bd87f37c58b7da25b675c5456506d6

Change-Id: Idcacfb6dbfb0760128f10dbc0573856e4250b3bc
Closes-Bug: #1771969

commit_message:
Add retry_on_deadlock to policy operations

I believe that policy detach needs a retry on deadlock added to it
as it is an operation that requires the cluster to be locked.

Input on this would be helpful.

Change-Id: I5b6662e0e08f01ed720778bf3d8313a1ffe68aa9

subject: SQUASH: test find_shard_range with overlaps
messages:
[{'account_id': 7847, 'date': '2018-05-15 17:47:08.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 7847, 'date': '2018-05-15 17:57:35.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2018-05-15 18:42:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2

(3 comments)

These are definitely all good test additions, but I'm gonna want to play around with it a little more to feel confident about our use of bisect being correct. In particular, building on your test_utils change:

 >>> bounds = [('', 'a'), ('a', 'f'), ('f', 'h'), ('h', 'k'), ('f', 'l'), ('l', 'r'), ('r', 'z'), ('z', '')]
 >>> sr = [ShardRange('a/%s-%s' % (l, u), Timestamp.now(), l, u) for l, u in bounds]
 >>> sorted(sr) == sr
 True # Good
 >>> [a < b for a, b in zip(sr, sr[1:])]
 [True, True, True, False, True, True, True] # Bad

Meanwhile, bisect assumes "a list in sorted order" -- so the fact that ShardRange('a/h-k', ...) < ShardRange('a/f-l', ...) is not True worries me. The test helps, but I worry about it being the result of good luck rather than correctness. I'll work on getting sufficient coverage to feel good about it.'}, {'account_id': 7847, 'date': '2018-05-17 09:06:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(3 comments)'}, {'account_id': 7847, 'date': '2018-05-18 17:44:01.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-05-17 18:48:37.000000000', 'message': 'SQUASH: clarify conditions for being able to shard a db

Before, object rows would not be replicated if a db had shard
ranges. However, in order to shard the db must also have its
own shard range in a state > ACTIVE, so this should be included
in the condition for not replicating object rows.

Similarly, a db can only be considered to require sharding if
it has an own shard range in state > ACTIVE.

Change-Id: I168fdb43acfba774984a801b7ecbb11615eb5186
'}]
commit_message:
SQUASH: clarify conditions for being able to shard a db

Before, object rows would not be replicated if a db had shard
ranges. However, in order to shard the db must also have its
own shard range in a state > ACTIVE, so this should be included
in the condition for not replicating object rows.

Similarly, a db can only be considered to require sharding if
it has an own shard range in state > ACTIVE.

Change-Id: I168fdb43acfba774984a801b7ecbb11615eb5186

commit_message:
Install all dependencies when building docs

RTD cannot install several requirements files (SIGH), not does it use
pip to install projects (SIGH#2). This change creates a new requirement
file doc/joined-requirements.txt and links to both doc/requirements.txt
and root requirements.txt from it.

Note that we cannot put -r instructions to doc/requirements.txt since
it's managed by global-requirements.

Change-Id: Iaebf5917dc20d063e506a055d9f5af4daee0415b

commit_message:
Removes unicode 'u' response from "glance image-tag-update"

"glance image-tag-update" command returns unicoded response
for lists. Therefore it requires print_list method from util
class to handle such case. Added unicode_key_value_to_string()
method to remove extra 'u' from lists and dictionaries. This
fix is inspired from cinderclient's implementation.

Change-Id: I16a04e8d34f7629f72fe389456001ca1db9335ea
Closes-bug: #1534046

commit_message:
Include TripleO in Deployment guides

This patch includes the link of TripleO documentation which is a uniq
link, unversioned, which means we'll have to include this link for every
new release.

Inside our doc, we have notes when something is release-specific, that's
how it always worked and we have no plan to change it.

commit_message:
Generate user passwords with special characters

When we create user accounts in order to allow signalling back to Heat,
generate the passwords using a mix of upper- and lower-case letters, digits
and special characters. This should pass most password_regex filters that
users are likely to configure in Keystone, which was not true of the
previous method (using only hex characters from a UUID).

Change-Id: I7702d6ab550e4f1f53c4cea9f67ed0402afbd66d
Closes-Bug: #1666129
Closes-Bug: #1444429
(cherry picked from commit 61412548aef0912b621861d08743821439172c6a)

commit_message:
Use metadata summary instead name for doc title

hint: ugly name like openstackdocumentationcontributorguide breaks
the page layout.

depends on the count of words and the length of the name it will use
name or summary.

Change-Id: Id3488cfab61be5791c34f4f4330087627e7b9719

commit_message:
Fix document formatting

After openstackdocstheme migration, extra whitespaces at the beginning
of lines lead to vertical lines and different fonts in rendered HTML.
This commit cleans up them for readability.

Change-Id: I27f25d068cff801dd4702278ecf8be14baebc890

messages:
[{'account_id': 8213, 'date': '2018-04-16 10:45:34.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 6928, 'date': '2018-05-04 14:55:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow-1

WIP per commit message.  If this is not still a WIP then please update the commit message.  Thanks.'}, {'account_id': 8213, 'date': '2018-05-07 10:57:42.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Indeed, I should remove the WIP from the commit title.

I've initially committed this as WIP since I needed a patch as Depends-On for this [1], since that's where I encoutered this issue.

Since the unittests using this patch passed, it means that this is mergeable.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/533146/"}, {'account_id': 8213, 'date': '2018-05-07 10:58:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 8213, 'date': '2018-05-07 10:59:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2018-05-17 13:54:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 6928, 'date': '2018-05-18 15:36:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-16 10:45:34.000000000', 'message': "WIP: mock: Perform patch's autospec checks on __enter__

Currently we're doing the autospec checks on __init__ (if the
target is autospecable), which will require importing modules
in some cases.

The mock.patch's constructor is called when a test module is being
loaded, before any set up could have been run, which can be problematic
in some cases (e.g.: some tested modules are importing platform specific
modules, and they couldn't have been mocked yet).

This patch moves the autospec checks to __enter__, which is executed
after the setUp.

Change-Id: I9e10b34092ad795c7f9e58596fcccf4f37856225
"}, {'created': '2018-05-07 10:58:10.000000000', 'message': "mock: Perform patch's autospec checks on __enter__

Currently we're doing the autospec checks on __init__ (if the
target is autospecable), which will require importing modules
in some cases.

The mock.patch's constructor is called when a test module is being
loaded, before any set up could have been run, which can be problematic
in some cases (e.g.: some tested modules are importing platform specific
modules, and they couldn't have been mocked yet).

This patch moves the autospec checks to __enter__, which is executed
after the setUp.

Change-Id: I9e10b34092ad795c7f9e58596fcccf4f37856225
"}, {'created': '2018-05-07 10:59:11.000000000', 'message': "mock: Perform patch's autospec checks on __enter__

Currently we're doing the autospec checks on __init__ (if the
target is autospecable), which will require importing modules
in some cases.

The mock.patch's constructor is called when a test module is being
loaded, before any set up could have been run, which can be problematic
in some cases (e.g.: some tested modules are importing platform specific
modules, and they couldn't have been mocked yet).

This patch moves the autospec checks to __enter__, which is executed
after the setUp.

Related-Bug: #1735588

Change-Id: I9e10b34092ad795c7f9e58596fcccf4f37856225
"}]
commit_message:
mock: Perform patch's autospec checks on __enter__

Currently we're doing the autospec checks on __init__ (if the
target is autospecable), which will require importing modules
in some cases.

The mock.patch's constructor is called when a test module is being
loaded, before any set up could have been run, which can be problematic
in some cases (e.g.: some tested modules are importing platform specific
modules, and they couldn't have been mocked yet).

This patch moves the autospec checks to __enter__, which is executed
after the setUp.

Related-Bug: #1735588

Change-Id: I9e10b34092ad795c7f9e58596fcccf4f37856225

commit_message:
Adding Swift backend Region support

This adds support to configure the region_name for the
Swift backend.

We need to override the object_storage_url, as the
swiftclient does not respect the region_name when
using sessions.

Change-Id: I13d9b1b6d75f2566622881286d80fba71dbc8af5
Closes-Bug: #1771647

[{'created': '2018-05-16 23:50:39.000000000', 'message': 'Remove tox_install.sh and align with constraints consumption

As part of removing reliance on the old and deprecated zuul-cloner, we
need to shift constraints declaration to the deps line. This means we
unfortunately have to duplicate the extras declarations into
test-requirements - because otherwise the contraints for keystoneauth
conflicts with the installation of itself.

(cherry picked from commit 8ece7fcf2d5eaa40b7ecf40e81cc16c09a599535)

Change-Id: If162dde93423a495064c4ae1a5dad4e7eb8f9577

commit_message:
Remove tox_install.sh and align with constraints consumption

As part of removing reliance on the old and deprecated zuul-cloner, we
need to shift constraints declaration to the deps line. This means we
unfortunately have to duplicate the extras declarations into
test-requirements - because otherwise the contraints for keystoneauth
conflicts with the installation of itself.

(cherry picked from commit 8ece7fcf2d5eaa40b7ecf40e81cc16c09a599535)

Change-Id: If162dde93423a495064c4ae1a5dad4e7eb8f9577

recheck'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2018-04-06 17:19:18.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

I compared the xstatic-vis repository and the upstream repository https://github.com/almende/vis. I checked 'v4.3.0' tag from the upstream repo and compared files under dist/vis.js and dist/vis.css.

* vis.js does not match
* vis.css does not exist in xstatic-vis, though vis.scss exists.

The original files should be packaged.

-1 to this release.

(Note that this kind of things should be reviewed in xstatic-vis rpeo, but new core reviewer team did not fail to provide enough review. For further review, xstatic team should review the fix in the individual repo.)"}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2018-05-14 13:01:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

This request is more than a month old. Is it still valid?'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2018-05-18 15:13:04.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

This release request has been open for over a month without action. Please reopen it or file a new one when you are ready for a release.'}]

commit_message:
Use apache for glance-api if Debian and SSL

It looks like using Eventlet + Python 3 + SSL is broken, so we need to
force using Apache2 in the case of Debian if using SSL.

Depends-On: I54f92b44a310aac1fa1d4eb277010aa062adcb32
Change-Id: Ifacd3967e62dcbefaa1ccb3d112eb38d9abb7d16

commit_message:
KubeADM: Keystone Kubernetes Webhook

This PS adds the ability to deploy the Keystone Kubernetes Webhook
chart via kubeadm-aio

Change-Id: I18b0477a775de942f940e9c0984559089dca1cdb
Co-Authored-By: Tin Lam <tin@irrational.io>
Co-Authored-By: Gage Hugo <gagehugo@gmail.com>
Signed-off-by: Pete Birley <pete@port.direct>

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-05-15 21:22:51.000000000', 'message': "Handle HTTP headers per RFC 8187

According to RFC 8187, HTTP headers should use 7-bit ASCII encoding.
The glanceclient was encoding them as UTF-8, which can leave the 8th
bit nonzero when representing unicode, and which presents problems
for any recipient following the standard and decoding the headers as
ASCII.

The dependency is a keystoneauth1 change that can handle headers as
encoded as bytes (it's a fix for a change that was breaking on bytes
in headers).
Depends-on: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/568365/

Change-Id: I0d14974126fcb20e23a37347f4f1756c323cf2f5
Closes-bug: #1766235
"}, {'created': '2018-05-16 14:45:39.000000000', 'message': "DNM: Handle HTTP headers per RFC 8187

(The reason not to merge is that this patch currently contains a
special job in .zull.yaml so that it can be tested against the
keystoneauth1 depencency.)

According to RFC 8187, HTTP headers should use 7-bit ASCII encoding.
The glanceclient was encoding them as UTF-8, which can leave the 8th
bit nonzero when representing unicode, and which presents problems
for any recipient following the standard and decoding the headers as
ASCII.

The dependency is a keystoneauth1 change that can handle headers as
encoded as bytes (it's a fix for a change that was breaking on bytes
in headers).
Depends-on: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/568365/

Change-Id: I0d14974126fcb20e23a37347f4f1756c323cf2f5
Closes-bug: #1766235
"}, {'created': '2018-05-17 19:54:15.000000000', 'message': 'Handle HTTP headers per RFC 8187

According to RFC 8187, HTTP headers should use 7-bit ASCII encoding.
The glanceclient was encoding them as UTF-8, which can leave the 8th
bit nonzero when representing unicode, and which presents problems
for any recipient following the standard and decoding the headers as
ASCII.

This change requires keystoneauth1 3.6.2, which has a fix for a
bug that made it unable to handle bytes in headers.  The dependency
is a patch bumping the keystoneauth1 version in upper-constraints.

Depends-on: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/569138/

Change-Id: I0d14974126fcb20e23a37347f4f1756c323cf2f5
Closes-bug: #1766235
'}]
commit_message:
Handle HTTP headers per RFC 8187

According to RFC 8187, HTTP headers should use 7-bit ASCII encoding.
The glanceclient was encoding them as UTF-8, which can leave the 8th
bit nonzero when representing unicode, and which presents problems
for any recipient following the standard and decoding the headers as
ASCII.

This change requires keystoneauth1 3.6.2, which has a fix for a
bug that made it unable to handle bytes in headers.  The dependency
is a patch bumping the keystoneauth1 version in upper-constraints.

Depends-on: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/569138/

Change-Id: I0d14974126fcb20e23a37347f4f1756c323cf2f5
Closes-bug: #1766235

commit_message:
Remove admin rights need from verify_keystone_connection

This patch sets changes the call perform to verify keystone
connectivity from project list to region list, as the former
needs admin rights by default. In addion, usually the number of
regions is low, so it should be a non expensive call to keystone.

Closes-Bug: 1772005

Change-Id: Iabca253a86dc89b567a9a68b09cef015c9a482b0

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-05-17 10:58:07.000000000', 'message': 'Fix for fatal error when GPT was used and only MBR was cleaned

You can generate this error if after having provisioned a node
using GPT partitioning, you clean its MBR using say
dd if=/dev/zero bs=1024 count=1 of=/dev/sda
and then cleanup all Ironic/Bifrost informations to get it
reprovisioned.
In this case sgdisk -Z returns an error and last_error field
in Ironic contains:
Error writing image to device: Writing image to device
        /dev/sda failed with exit code 2
Caution: invalid main GPT header, but valid backup;
        regenerating main header\nfrom backup!\n
        \nInvalid partition data!\

Change-Id: Ib617737fff5e40cb376edda0232e0726d9c71231
'}]
commit_message:
Fix for fatal error when GPT was used and only MBR was cleaned

You can generate this error if after having provisioned a node
using GPT partitioning, you clean its MBR using say
dd if=/dev/zero bs=1024 count=1 of=/dev/sda
and then cleanup all Ironic/Bifrost informations to get it
reprovisioned.
In this case sgdisk -Z returns an error and last_error field
in Ironic contains:
Error writing image to device: Writing image to device
        /dev/sda failed with exit code 2
Caution: invalid main GPT header, but valid backup;
        regenerating main header\nfrom backup!\n
        \nInvalid partition data!\

Change-Id: Ib617737fff5e40cb376edda0232e0726d9c71231

[{'created': '2018-01-05 02:14:12.000000000', 'message': 'Unity: Fix duplicate hosts created with same name

In some circumstance, there is a race condition in querying/creating
Unity host thus multiple hosts with same name were created.

This issue stops any further attach/detach operation.

This patch leverage the DSL in cinder to avoid above race condition.

Change-Id: I3b775da8c5e862def54e9d44d7b157cf17a07a24
Closes-bug: #1726284

commit_message:
Unity: Fix duplicate hosts created with same name

In some circumstance, there is a race condition in querying/creating
Unity host thus multiple hosts with same name were created.

This issue stops any further attach/detach operation.

This patch leverage the DSL in cinder to avoid above race condition.

Change-Id: I3b775da8c5e862def54e9d44d7b157cf17a07a24
Closes-bug: #1726284
(cherry picked from commit d8dd30f16b8712385b2f0d43c4d0a45f5fe4be41)
(cherry picked from commit 85bc7559fb3b8c8ff3d508b3ef54bc4ba4a0591f)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-05-08 15:33:28.000000000', 'message': "Fix hostname validation regex.

With the addition of the fields validation on the API, cinder now
oes not allow ':' and '/' characters on the hostname field. Some
drivers use there characters for the hostname of the volumes, mainly
for the NFS implementation. This patch fixes that by adding these
characters to the validation regex.

Closes-Bug: #1769889
Change-Id: Ib8f00df49f126fc8533494ba5823da031191cea9
"}, {'created': '2018-05-08 19:48:13.000000000', 'message': "Fix hostname validation regex.

With the addition of the fields validation on the API, cinder now
oes not allow ':' and '/' characters on the hostname field. Some
drivers use there characters for the hostname of the volumes, mainly
for the NFS implementation. This patch fixes that by adding these
characters to the validation regex.

Closes-Bug: #1769889
Change-Id: Ib8f00df49f126fc8533494ba5823da031191cea9
"}, {'created': '2018-05-09 18:44:43.000000000', 'message': "Fix hostname validation regex.

commit_message:
Fix hostname validation regex.

With the addition of the fields validation on the API, cinder now
does not allow ':' and '/' characters on the hostname field. Some
drivers use these characters for the hostname of the volumes, mainly
for the NFS implementation. This patch fixes that by adding these
characters to the validation regex.

Closes-Bug: #1769889
Change-Id: Ib8f00df49f126fc8533494ba5823da031191cea9

[{'created': '2018-05-14 05:56:57.000000000', 'message': "Huawei driver supports create_group_from_src

Huawei driver doesn't implement create_group_from_src interface right now,
though Cinder framework provides a generic implementation, but it cannot
guarantee the group volume data consistency for Huawei driver, so Huawei
driver is supposed to provide this ability itself.

Change-Id: I73b227bae51997bebb9070cc48466f5e0b3699c3
Closes-Bug: #1763242
(cherry picked from commit cce4f7d355ebcc7e0ec6168544a6d138e6bdd79d)
"}]
commit_message:
Huawei driver supports create_group_from_src

Huawei driver doesn't implement create_group_from_src interface right now,
though Cinder framework provides a generic implementation, but it cannot
guarantee the group volume data consistency for Huawei driver, so Huawei
driver is supposed to provide this ability itself.

Change-Id: I73b227bae51997bebb9070cc48466f5e0b3699c3
Closes-Bug: #1763242
(cherry picked from commit cce4f7d355ebcc7e0ec6168544a6d138e6bdd79d)

commit_message:
[Api-ref] fix incorrect host value in worker cleanup api

The value of host in sample request and sample response is not correct,
this change is to update this.


Change-Id: If8524a08795c222e67ca2c85243a42fb27e43bdb
Close-bug: #1758955

commit_message:
Dell EMC SC: Find volume folder API call fails on root folders

Changes to the SC API have changed how calls are made to the
StorageCenter/ScVolumeFolder/GetList payload filter options. In
the case of a folder under root this call could fail depending on
the API.

Change-Id: I2ab2160478d2163dbb45175aa5f1b884f316db24
(cherry picked from commit c9a7fb8da533251772b79140c7161b393c52f15b)
(cherry picked from commit c9722a78b2dd5e7ae636fb6a6ac4c5996e1fbc56)

commit_message:
Dell EMC SC: API 4.0 incompatibilities

4.0 folder paths begin with a /. Also add a check that the user formatted
the folder path correctly.

Change-Id: I9bdc17c3f0daab97c33908bf3b96fbce963aa9f2
Closes-Bug: #1719428
(cherry picked from commit d414696c66ebc30c098cbb1ae24e4e772c15aca4)
(cherry picked from commit bfc740588fada01a28add541239d224efc7e2bb3)

commit_message:
Dell EMC SC: ISCSI initialize_connection fixes.

Driver was not honoring the server in ISCSI and returning connection
information for all servers (IQNs) connected to a volume.

If multiple servers are mapped to a volume the driver was only returning
the first server for a given portal.

Closes-Bug: #1756914
Change-Id: If65780000fa8f59f663b00b88584cf289effa590
(cherry picked from commit 96b77e0aa62790320d16f7229aaeeb650fa875b6)
(cherry picked from commit adf7d84b66fdbbfba03721cc5f3f1f392a702eb4)

commit_message:
VMAX Driver - Ocata, detaches fail when volume missing from backend

Detaches are failing when the volume has been deleted externally
from the VMAX backend. This is due to insufficient error handling.

This is only in Ocata and pre Ocata versions as we changed from
SMI-S to U4V REST in Pike.

Change-Id: Id9003ee38183e53ce8fa6d84ff79034ce9e7c3a1
Closes-Bug: #1756368

commit_message:
Solving permission errors due to directory ownership on NFS

We do the same work as the GlusterfsBackupDriver, uses chgrp+chmod to set
proper permissions on the directories if needs be.

Change-Id: Ic57c122311039af159c0cfc083e6e9349702d1e4
Closes-Bug: #1715456
(cherry picked from commit dd4c31f527e2c8f93fdfa55fe6713e0e32d94cc9)
(cherry picked from commit 0f3fb16ba3da0fdfc816887aa06920740824bc68)
(cherry picked from commit 9d06094c26dee3d5a87b5ad8fb70f0424ee432f9)
Conflicts:
	cinder/tests/unit/backup/drivers/test_backup_nfs.py

commit_message:
NetApp ONTAP: Copy offload bugfix

When 'NetApp NFS Copy Offload' tool is configured to download Glance
images, these images are downloaded twice because the tool is doing
the job after Cinder has already done it.
This patch fixes the bug by executing the copy offload tool inside the
clone_image function instead of using the copy_image_to_volume.

Closes-bug: #1632333
Depends-on: https://review.openstack.org/542770

Change-Id: I5c6ad150543213acfd0c78dbbdb1dc1584d22d26
(cherry-picked from commit c27173bad69da4889a5237cf2becc14bb6fc578a)

commit_message:
VMAX driver Ocata - backward compatibility fix

Launchpad 1401297 breaks backward compatibility with Newton. This
fixes the issue by checking for the existence of the uuid within
the ElementName rather than a full equality check

Change-Id: Iddf2908ab28825a9082989cb1392ba59379f4bf5
Closes-Bug: #1745183

inside the container instead of on the host running the container. this
change adds the forgotten delegate_to to correct that.

commit_message:
Add missing "delegate_to"

All of the qgroup commands were failing due to them being executed
inside the container instead of on the host running the container. this
change adds the forgotten delegate_to to correct that.

Change-Id: I0ff97d42fb20065613af24c65f523793a3b58fae
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

commit_message:
Correct log location in container environment for Fluentd

Since we moved services in containers, their logs aren't in the old location, but
in /var/log/containers/<service>. This patch fixes the generated Hiera hash used
by Fluentd for its configuration

Regarding Designate config service: some of the yaml doesn't use at all the
`service_config_settings` parameter - they will need to be updated accordingly
once it's supported

Co-Authored-By: Thomas Herve <therve@redhat.com>, Steven Hardy <shardy@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I1bc0930de4053dc1c34b50477e82d9ccdab7ae2e
Closes-Bug: 1769051
Related-Bug: 1674715

Current Kaminario K2 driver only supports iSCSI multipathing using
discovery (sendtargets), which in some cases may be undesirable, since a
broken primary path could prevent an attachment.

This code adds the possibility of not using discovery mode and return

should provide increased reliability.

commit_message:
Kaminario K2: Add non discovery iSCSI multipath

Current Kaminario K2 driver only supports iSCSI multipathing using
discovery (sendtargets), which in some cases may be undesirable, since a
broken primary path could prevent an attachment.

This code adds the possibility of not using discovery mode and return
all connection information when `initialize_connection` is called, which
should provide increased reliability.

Change-Id: I7932b1d952844b49cfdb504ed0ba188b489d7f44
(cherry picked from commit c9ec9b9bd755f042dbe1ccbdc5e3ff87fa60269c)
(cherry picked from commit 7bcb2ff94cf38eaa9def1115569981760e36510c)

commit_message:
StorageCenter: Fix volume mapping for API v3.1

Volume attachment fails on StorageCenter API v3.1 because the backend
instead of returning wwn or WWN as the key in the controller port it
returns wWN, thus preventing the driver from finding the mapping.

This patch adds support to any combination of upper and lower case of
the WWN key.

Closes-Bug: #1739651
Change-Id: Ie6ec59b4f6d31cb72e37f25f5347c815fee5af48
(cherry picked from commit b50e08bcd8618d9b7935b0245d8b764912c919be)
(cherry picked from commit 0652a58069af9e908d12dd1f1fac8b6a8a8c6c2a)

commit_message:
Fix google backup driver

Current backup driver is broken due to the upper constraints of
google-api-python-client which is set to 1.6.6, but after 1.6.0
parameter http and credentials are mutually exclusive, the driver is
also using the no longer preferred Google authentication library.

This patch fixes this by only using the http_proxy environmental
variable to set the proxying and adding support for google-auth and
using it whenever possible.

Closes-Bug: #1736569
Closes-Bug: #1769660
Change-Id: If1e34ea112b0cff328a58ec2fc9c3f5a5005f1c6

commit_message:
Huawei driver supports create_group_from_src

Huawei driver doesn't implement create_group_from_src interface right now,
though Cinder framework provides a generic implementation, but it cannot
guarantee the group volume data consistency for Huawei driver, so Huawei
driver is supposed to provide this ability itself.

Change-Id: I73b227bae51997bebb9070cc48466f5e0b3699c3
Closes-Bug: #1763242

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-05-11 14:26:50.000000000', 'message': 'NetApp ONTAP iSCSI: Force exception on online extend

The Netapp ONTAP iSCSI driver does not support online volume extend. It
may work if the requested size does not exceed the LUN max geometry,
otherwise it will require the LUN to be detached. In such case, the
backend currently detaches and leaves the volume in an inconsistent
state.

This patch forces the ONTAP iSCSI driver to raise an exception whenever
an online extend is requested and it detects it would exceed the LUN max
geometry.

Change-Id: Ie3dddbc05c6cd32e27168d68f4cb819364b0438c
Closes-Bug: #1712651
'}]
commit_message:
NetApp ONTAP iSCSI: Force exception on online extend

The Netapp ONTAP iSCSI driver does not support online volume extend. It
may work if the requested size does not exceed the LUN max geometry,
otherwise it will require the LUN to be detached. In such case, the
backend currently detaches and leaves the volume in an inconsistent
state.

This patch forces the ONTAP iSCSI driver to raise an exception whenever
an online extend is requested and it detects it would exceed the LUN max
geometry.

Change-Id: Ie3dddbc05c6cd32e27168d68f4cb819364b0438c
Closes-Bug: #1712651

commit_message:
Remove Cinder API v1 compatibility

Since Cinder API v1 is removed in I03bf2db5bd7e2fdfb4f6032758ccaf2b348a82ba
we don't _replace_v2_parameters function anymore.

Change-Id: Ie863383ae5c81dc52138950dc9658b22a48d88f2

commit_message:
Added test to update the database schema to the latest revision

If developer make a mistake in a migration script that CI doesn't show
the error. This patch fixed it adding execution of upgrade database
command before PostgreSQL and MySQL tests.

Closes-Bug: #1611036
Change-Id: I641e39da6a66528e940a1924ba9c4797bbaa2a11
Signed-off-by: Vitalii Solodilov <mcdkr@yandex.ru>

commit_message:
Add method for getting dlrn_hash from release and hash_name

This method will parse the full repo hash from the delorean.repo
file in a similar way to what we currently do via bash in the
release files. In the future, it may be better to just get this
data directly via the DLRN API.

Unittests included which assert the validity of the regex used
to parse the delorean.repo file, as well as the format of the
repo URL.

Change-Id: Ic7177d0ad1fcec5635d16d360b425f3b2737f668

commit_message:
Fix issues in governance page

Upon reviewing the governance content I found numerous issues.
There was a broken ref because it was split.  A few miss-spellings
and some sentences that were hard to understand.  This patch
resolves those issues.

Change-Id: I51e1c28faf5be1d54f1475dc982dfb5c8b91ce9c

commit_message:
Move ironic_glance_api_servers variable into role

As part of cleaning inventory variables, we are
moving some of the variables to be created in
roles instead of in inventory. This moves the
ironic_glance_api_servers variable into role.

Change-Id: I983a20d923384bf54cb0af924ec0a0f8ef4db191

commit_message:
Temporary disable update of IPA image in jobs

Don't update IPA image, use the provided from promotion.
Introspection fails when we unpack and pack again IPA images,
let's use promoted one in jobs until bug 1770972 if fixed.

Related-Bug: 1770972

Change-Id: Iab5565d1743d7a6d9aa9fdb5473b3b3e5fea7c62

metalsmith.exceptions to avoid clutterning the former.

Updated tox.ini to use upper-constraints.

commit_message:
Allow undercloud to use 'become' tasks

This should allow tasks that need sudo to be used against the undercloud.
Tried to minimize the exposure surface off this.

Change-Id: I8891183e780a1ea73f9d9e1055960f45d8809afc

subject: Stop using pbr autodoc
messages:
[{'account_id': 2, 'date': '2018-05-16 15:56:45.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 2903, 'date': '2018-05-16 16:08:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

+2 if Zuul approves.'}, {'account_id': 8482, 'date': '2018-05-16 16:28:18.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

I'm not a fan of this. Don't other projects use autodoc for API projects? What is making keystoneauth such a pain? I would prefer to get to the root cause."}, {'account_id': 2903, 'date': '2018-05-16 18:30:36.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

I'm inclined to say we drop autodoc, seems like is not happy with modern sphinx (lots of testing, consistent failures past 1.6.5 of sphinx). will hold on +A until colleen changes her -1 or comments she is ok.

only 12 projects use pbr autodoc at this point."}, {'account_id': 8482, 'date': '2018-05-16 18:38:56.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: -Code-Review

This doesn't seem completely necessary, things have started passing again: http://logs.openstack.org/65/568365/5/check/build-openstack-sphinx-docs/27a7081/html/

Since this doesn't seem to be urgent anymore I'd still prefer not to merge this and take some time to figure out the issue. However, I don't have time to do that myself this afternoon so I won't hold up this patch if you think it's really necessary."}, {'account_id': 2903, 'date': '2018-05-16 18:46:34.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Workflow-1

holding WIP, if everything simmers down we'll hold on to this for now, if breakage occurrs we'll fast merge to unbreak."}, {'account_id': 2, 'date': '2018-05-18 11:52:28.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-05-16 15:56:45.000000000', 'message': "Stop using pbr autodoc

The keystoneauth API is not fast moving, so just maintaining API docs by

commit_message:
Stop using pbr autodoc

The keystoneauth API is not fast moving, so just maintaining API docs by
hand at this point should not be terribly distressing.

This is the result of running the pbr autodoc function and committing
the files. The autodoc of the unittests was removed, because let's face
it, that's not actually part of the API.

Change-Id: Ic39ede538f0d0e8c882a64696ee06c2bb105d08c

commit_message:
Enable agent_ipmitool and pxe_ipmitool drivers

Otherwise, the standalone tests are being skipped and not
tested. Currently a proper test for those can only be seen
at stable/queens and stable/pike jobs.

Change-Id: I9e1ed11bb4d1abf606128086d000ece92442cfed

commit_message:
Run inventory-manage.py from the ansible-runtime venv

bootstrap-ansible installs prettytables in the ansible-runtime
venv. inventory-manage.py requires prettytables, so should use
the venv.

Change-Id: I5bcc8f78ec8a1a175f0bfae3f38101d26e7e3803
(cherry picked from commit c0b691ec42d8cef281d6630e6f50e5ebf4c63b44)

commit_message:
Use rabbitmq service principal in metadata settings

We don't request a certificate for oslo_messaging_rpc, so we use
rabbitmq (the one we used to use) instead.

Closes-Bug: #1771744
Change-Id: I05ef290215fa0303b3be6ddb4462e7ca02b2d71b

commit_message:
Fix certificate ownership of rabbitmq

We no longer have the rabbitmq user as part of the overcloud
hosts. We rely instead on kolla setting the right permissions in
the container.

Change-Id: Iaa159fcfe78d16be59e2d9baf51a65119f50c427
Closes-Bug: #1771752

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-05-15 07:45:14.000000000', 'message': 'Move database creation into role

There is no record for why we implement the database creation outside
of the role in the playbook, when we could do it inside the role.

Implementing it inside the role allows us to reduce the quantity of
group_vars duplicated from the role, and allows us to better document
the required variables in the role. The delegation can still be done
as it is done in the playbook too.

In this patch we remove the test-vars which were duplicated from the
role, and remove the DB setup tasks as they are no longer required.

Change-Id: I0dfe0bd8316ff7c1db916aa8e8d6c13d0715b30d
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/568481

commit_message:
Move database creation into role (glance)

There is no record for why we implement the database creation outside
of the role in the playbook, when we could do it inside the role.

Implementing it inside the role allows us to reduce the quantity of
group_vars duplicated from the role, and allows us to better document
the required variables in the role. The delegation can still be done
as it is done in the playbook too.

In this patch we remove the test-vars which were duplicated from the
role, and remove the DB setup tasks as they are no longer required.

Change-Id: I0dfe0bd8316ff7c1db916aa8e8d6c13d0715b30d
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/568481

commit_message:
Validate neutron-server service

To avoid failure, in Debian and Ubuntu, we must set $validate to true.
While this issue happened all the time for me on my laptop, I also saw a
few Ubuntu run where the problem happened.

Depends-On: I8ab8a2c7bb1d93d6fb9d16eabd3a1112b1e1237b
Change-Id: I093b0de94e3f762edb9be71134078d86b0642a07

I couldn't make is work with the old configuration (driver = iptables_v2) or with the new (service_provider = ...)"}, {'account_id': 55, 'date': '2018-05-03 09:00:20.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 20:

> Still about the backwards compatibility issue: Can you explain how
 > one will use the existing iptables_v2 driver with the new code? I
 > couldn't make is work with the old configuration (driver =
 > iptables_v2) or with the new (service_provider = ...)

Adit, I had a quick look to the NSX FWaaSv2 driver and it seems you are using the agent python interface [1].
You can continuing to use it with my patch, you just have to update the module path of that interface [2].
Here [3], do:
 -     from neutron_fwaas.services.firewall.drivers import fwaas_base
 +     from neutron_fwaas.services.firewall.service_drivers.agents.drivers import fwaas_base_v2
(there is 2 agent driver interfaces, one for FWaaSv1 and another one for FWaaSv2, but FWaaSv1 interface also contains FWaaSv2 methods, don't understand why)
Then you should define the 'Agent DB' provider driver:
 service_plugins = firewall_v2
 [service_providers]
 service_provider = FIREWALL_V2:fwaas_db:neutron_fwaas.services.firewall.service_drivers.agents.agents.FirewallAgentDriver:default
That should work. You can ping me on IRC #openstack-fwaas as 'doude' to discuss it, I'm in Paris time zone (UTC+2).

[1] https://github.com/openstack/neutron-fwaas/blob/master/neutron_fwaas/services/firewall/drivers/fwaas_base_v2.py#L22
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/480265/20/neutron_fwaas/services/firewall/service_drivers/agents/drivers/fwaas_base_v2.py@22
[3] https://github.com/openstack/vmware-nsx/blob/master/vmware_nsx/services/fwaas/nsx_v3/edge_fwaas_driver_base.py#L33"}, {'account_id': 15471, 'date': '2018-05-03 10:14:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 19:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 15471, 'date': '2018-05-03 10:33:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 19:

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-07-04 16:49:47.000000000', 'message': "Implements a plugable backend driver

This patch remove all related DB code from the FWaaS service plugin v2
and create service driver interfaces that can be used by different
backend drivers.

The default backend driver based on the Neutron DB model
and agent RPC (for l3 and l2 agent in a near future) was moved to
'service_drivers.agents.agents.FwaasAgentDriver'. It inherits from the
service driver DB insterface
'service_drivers.driver_api.FwaasDriverDBMixin' to maintain the DB. It
is in charges to implement all RPC messages.

If we need to implement a backend driver which depends on the Neutron DB
but not on the agent RPC service, we just have to inherit from the DB
interface and if we like to develop a backend driver which not depends
on the Neutron DB model, we can inherit from the base driver interface
'service_driver.driver_api.FwaasDriverBase'.

That patch only modifies the service plugin 'firewall_v2'.

/!\ The unit tests was not updated /!\

TODO: for the moment 'service_drivers.driver_api.FwaasDriverDBMixin'
does not provide any python interface but the default agent backend
overloads driver methods if needed. We could improve that by defining an
interface for specific driver method with a pre/post hooks mechanism
like we did in networking-bgpvpn [1] thanks to the DB session
context [2].

[1] https://github.com/openstack/networking-bgpvpn/blob/master/networking_bgpvpn/neutron/services/service_drivers/driver_api.py#L226
[2] https://github.com/openstack/networking-bgpvpn/blob/master/networking_bgpvpn/neutron/services/service_drivers/driver_api.py#L103

Change-Id: I4ebd24f1b13eb823c4d63452fd37cace5bcf5481
"}, {'created': '2017-07-05 09:25:57.000000000', 'message': "Implements a plugable backend driver

This patch remove all related DB code from the FWaaS service plugin v2
and create service driver interfaces that can be used by different
backend drivers.

The default backend driver based on the Neutron DB model
and agent RPC (for l3 and l2 agent in a near future) was moved to
'service_drivers.agents.agents.FwaasAgentDriver'. It inherits from the
service driver DB insterface
'service_drivers.driver_api.FwaasDriverDBMixin' to maintain the DB. It
is in charges to implement all RPC messages.

If we need to implement a backend driver which depends on the Neutron DB
but not on the agent RPC service, we just have to inherit from the DB
interface and if we like to develop a backend driver which not depends
on the Neutron DB model, we can inherit from the base driver interface
'service_driver.driver_api.FwaasDriverBase'.

That patch only modifies the service plugin 'firewall_v2'.

/!\ The unit tests was not updated /!\

TODO: for the moment 'service_drivers.driver_api.FwaasDriverDBMixin'
does not provide any python interface but the default agent backend
overloads driver methods if needed. We could improve that by defining an
interface for specific driver method with a pre/post hooks mechanism
like we did in networking-bgpvpn [1] thanks to the DB session
context [2].

[1] https://github.com/openstack/networking-bgpvpn/blob/master/networking_bgpvpn/neutron/services/service_drivers/driver_api.py#L226
[2] https://github.com/openstack/networking-bgpvpn/blob/master/networking_bgpvpn/neutron/services/service_drivers/driver_api.py#L103

Closes-Bug: #1702312
Change-Id: I4ebd24f1b13eb823c4d63452fd37cace5bcf5481

"}, {'created': '2018-01-10 12:00:16.000000000', 'message': "Implements a plugable backend driver

This patch removes all related DB code from the FWaaS service plugin v2
and creates service driver interfaces that can be used by different
backend drivers.

The default backend driver still based on the Neutron DB model
and agent RPC interface (for l3 and l2 agents) and was moved
to 'service_drivers.agents.agents.FwaasAgentDriver'. It inherits from the
firewall backend driver DB interface
'service_drivers.driver_api.FwaasDriverDB' to maintain the DB. It
is in charge to implement all RPC API and messages.

If we need to implement a backend driver which depends on the Neutron DB
but not on the agent RPC service, we just have to inherit from the DB
interface and if we like to develop a backend driver which not depends
on the Neutron DB model, we can inherit from the base driver interface
'service_driver.driver_api.FwaasDriver'.

That patch only modifies the service plugin 'firewall_v2', it does not
modify the Firewall v1 service plugin.

The backend DB driver provides an interface composed to a pre and post
commit hooks for each FWaaSv2 API actions which permits to the driver to
be warn anytimes. All that commit hooks methods does not do anything by
default and the backend driver needs to overide needed hooks.
The driver does not needs to implements all of them,

Closes-Bug: #1702312
Change-Id: I4ebd24f1b13eb823c4d63452fd37cace5bcf5481

commit_message:
Implements a plugable backend driver

This patch removes all related DB code from the FWaaS service plugin v2
and creates service driver interfaces that can be used by different
backend drivers.

The default backend driver still based on the Neutron DB model
and agent RPC interface (for l3 and l2 agents) and was moved
to 'service_drivers.agents.agents.FwaasAgentDriver'. It inherits from the
firewall backend driver DB interface
'service_drivers.driver_api.FwaasDriverDB' to maintain the DB. It
is in charge to implement all RPC API and messages.

If we need to implement a backend driver which depends on the Neutron DB
but not on the agent RPC service, we just have to inherit from the DB
interface and if we like to develop a backend driver which not depends
on the Neutron DB model, we can inherit from the base driver interface
'service_driver.driver_api.FwaasDriver'.

That patch only modifies the service plugin 'firewall_v2', it does not
modify the Firewall v1 service plugin.

The backend DB driver provides an interface composed to a pre and post
commit hooks for each FWaaSv2 API actions which permits to the driver to
be warn anytimes. All that commit hooks methods does not do anything by
default and the backend driver needs to overide needed hooks.
The driver does not needs to implements all of them,

Closes-Bug: #1702312
Change-Id: I4ebd24f1b13eb823c4d63452fd37cace5bcf5481

Shouldn't we do this in the creation of the service tenant rather than adjusting it after the fact via ansible/octavia?"}, {'account_id': 6681, 'date': '2018-05-16 10:48:12.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

I'm not sure that we can. The quotas in question live in the various services (nova, neutron, etc) and can only be created after db sync ops have been completed and an API service for that component has been made available. I think we also need to do some provider work on the puppet side to allow per-tenant quota overrides."}, {'account_id': 6681, 'date': '2018-05-16 12:25:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

 > db sync ops have been completed and an API service for that
 > component has been made available. I think we also need to do some
 > provider work on the puppet side to allow per-tenant quota
 > overrides.

After considering the complications that might be introduced using this approach (e.g. another integration effort attempting to do something similar but conflicting) I think it's worthwhile at least sorting out what needs to be done to take a "through puppet" approach.'}, {'account_id': 6681, 'date': '2018-05-16 12:25:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Workflow-1'}, {'account_id': 6681, 'date': '2018-05-16 12:45:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: -Workflow'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2018-05-17 16:24:09.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5: -Code-Review

commit_message:
Increase services project quotas when deploying Octavia

Octavia currently launches load balancer VMs in the services tenant
which has very low quotas by default. This patch increases the values
through the API for the services project to permit lots of load
balancers.

Closes Bug: #1769896

Change-Id: I6b87b147d301dea3251fe4509b04cd4b9b27ddba

commit_message:
Simplify fact setting

The conditionals are currently difficult to follow.
This simplifies them by splitting the fact setting
up and doing a fact refresh after the first one is
set.

Change-Id: I3f74d06ba3b246674e3ea3eb6ee1e5ca6e86a79b

subject: Revert "Switch public endpoints to use FQDNs by default"
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3153, 'name': 'Emilien Macchi', 'email': 'emilien@redhat.com', 'username': 'emilienm'}, {'_account_id': 6928, 'name': 'Ben Nemec', 'email': 'openstack@nemebean.com', 'username': 'bnemec'}, {'_account_id': 7144, 'name': 'James Slagle', 'email': 'jslagle@redhat.com', 'username': 'slagle'}, {'_account_id': 8042, 'name': 'Jiří Stránský', 'email': 'jistr@redhat.com', 'username': 'jistr'}, {'_account_id': 8866, 'name': 'Raildo Mascena de Sousa Filho', 'email': 'rmascena@redhat.com', 'username': 'raildo'}, {'_account_id': 8871, 'name': 'Elastic Recheck', 'username': 'elasticrecheck'}, {'_account_id': 10873, 'name': 'Juan Antonio Osorio Robles', 'email': 'jaosorior@redhat.com', 'username': 'ejuaoso'}, {'_account_id': 14985, 'name': 'Alex Schultz', 'email': 'aschultz@next-development.com', 'username': 'mwhahaha'}, {'_account_id': 20775, 'name': 'Carlos Camacho', 'email': 'ccamacho@redhat.com', 'username': 'ccamacho'}, {'_account_id': 20868, 'name': 'Jill Rouleau', 'email': 'jill.rouleau@bespokess.com', 'username': 'jillr'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 23181, 'name': 'RDO Third Party CI', 'email': 'dmsimard+rdothirdparty@redhat.com', 'username': 'rdothirdparty', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 23811, 'name': 'Oliver Walsh', 'email': 'owalsh@redhat.com', 'username': 'owalsh'}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 7144, 'date': '2018-05-16 16:54:44.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 7144, 'date': '2018-05-16 16:57:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 6928, 'date': '2018-05-16 17:04:45.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2

This also likely has upgrade implications, which are not addressed, even as a release note.

It also (AFAICT) makes predictable VIPs a mandatory feature since you need to pre-configure DNS if we do this.  None of this is currently documented as being the case.

And I'm not clear why we _need_ to use FQDNs for SSL.  We did SSL with IPs just fine before."}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2018-05-16 17:24:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 20868, 'date': '2018-05-16 19:35:00.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1

The original change leaves non-statically addressed environments (such as PoCs or local test envs) unusable.  It's also unclear what the FQDNs in custom-domain.yaml functionally refer to and how to specify their IPs for use.  At minimum, we need new documentation describing 1) how to disable this feature for dynamic overclouds and 2) how to properly configure static assignments.  Like, overcloud.localdomain should be br-ex on control0 and overcloud.internalapi.localdomain will be your Keystone IP and you specify the IPs for those in ${foo}.yaml."}, {'account_id': 7144, 'date': '2018-05-16 21:45:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 20868, 'date': '2018-05-16 22:58:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2018-05-17 02:03:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 10873, 'date': '2018-05-17 04:31:24.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

my original patch didn't require CloudName, but I was adviced to make it a requirement based on owalsh and sofer's work. Also, is it necessary to revert the whole thing? why not just fix the issue by making the CloudName an optional parameter?"}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2018-05-17 05:12:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: -Code-Review'}, {'account_id': 23811, 'date': '2018-05-17 09:29:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 7144, 'date': '2018-05-17 11:27:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

for CloudName, maybe.

what about the other comments as to why this needs to be reverted? You did not respond to those.'}, {'account_id': 7144, 'date': '2018-05-17 11:46:49.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

CloudName is not the only issue. If it was, I'd be fine with a fix just for that. The bigger issue is that we are now requiring hostnames, but there is no gaurantee those hostnames are resolvable from the undercloud or anywhere else.

Anyone following our TripleO documentation can not currently deploy because there is no way to resolve the overcloud hostnames by default."}, {'account_id': 10873, 'date': '2018-05-17 12:42:36.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1

We talked on IRC. And James is right in the fact that first we need to address the fact that the undercloud doesn't get the overcloud host entries; this makes it problematic for folks deploying stuff such as octavia. So I'll aim to address that. If this gets reverted, then I'll propose this change again with a dependency on a patch that would address the issue."}, {'account_id': 6928, 'date': '2018-05-17 14:09:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 23811, 'date': '2018-05-17 14:41:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2018-05-17 16:30:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 10873, 'date': '2018-05-18 08:40:04.000000000', 'content': 'Created a revert of this change as Ie57040644f2ccf5e5e7adfa058f7722e54c88421'}]

Change-Id: I2c5b511df50f29c63aa613899c2bebb506360bf4
'}, {'created': '2018-05-16 16:57:50.000000000', 'message': 'Revert "Switch public endpoints to use FQDNs by default"

Closes-Bug: #1771627

commit_message:
Revert "Switch public endpoints to use FQDNs by default"

This reverts commit 8e104b3c549118727b53c9825a438e799715b7f9.

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/559926/ introduced requiring CloudName.
This broke the documented deployment process. I also don't see how
CloudName can be required, but CloudDomain can not.

I don't see a technical reason why we can't keep the default as
localdomain. If necessary, we can instead add a parameter
validation instead of requiring the parameter.

Closes-Bug: #1771627
Depends-On: Ia86842b0b1f42512f25390d6bdb695e0f8133c6d
Change-Id: I2c5b511df50f29c63aa613899c2bebb506360bf4

commit_message:
Populate /etc/yum/vars/contentdir

The file /etc/yum.repos.d/CentOS-QEMU-EV.repo is assuming that
$contentdir is being populated, but it is not until new centos base
images include it.

This change detects the package architecture and populates contentdir
with 'centos' or 'altarch' as appropriate.

There is a kolla change equivalent here Ieb26c0aa65ba3ec1a45a33f87f670e5ecb782f82
The upstream discussion for adding contentdir is here:
https://lists.centos.org/pipermail/centos-devel/2018-March/016542.html

Change-Id: I6279bd4088bd87f37c58b7da25b675c5456506d6

subject: Revert "Use import/include_tasks"
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 167, 'name': 'Christian Berendt', 'email': 'berendt@osism.tech', 'username': 'berendt'}, {'_account_id': 538, 'name': 'Major Hayden', 'email': 'major@mhtx.net', 'username': 'rackerhacker'}, {'_account_id': 6816, 'name': 'Jesse Pretorius', 'email': 'jesse@odyssey4.me', 'username': 'jesse-pretorius'}, {'_account_id': 17068, 'name': 'Jean-Philippe Evrard', 'email': 'openstack@a.spamming.party', 'username': 'evrardjp'}, {'_account_id': 17799, 'name': 'Logan V', 'email': 'logan2211@gmail.com', 'username': 'Logan2211'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 23163, 'name': 'Markos Chandras (hwoarang)', 'email': 'markos@chandras.me', 'username': 'mchandras'}, {'_account_id': 23517, 'name': 'chenyb4', 'email': 'cybing4@gmail.com', 'username': 'Yuanbin.Chen'}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 167, 'date': '2018-02-14 21:03:15.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 167, 'date': '2018-02-14 21:04:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

At the moment the role is not usable with Ansible < 2.4. According to https://docs.ansible.com/ansible/2.4/include_tasks_module.html include_tasks was introduced with Ansible 2.4.'}, {'account_id': 167, 'date': '2018-02-14 21:05:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Just tested this with our new testbed, running Ansible 2.3:

The error appears to have been in '/home/travis/build/osism/testbed/environments/manager/roles/hardening/tasks/main.yml': line 55, column 5, but may
be elsewhere in the file depending on the exact syntax problem.
The offending line appears to be:
  - include_tasks: "{{ stig_version }}stig/main.yml"
    ^ here
We could be wrong, but this one looks like it might be an issue with
missing quotes.  Always quote template expression brackets when they
start a value. For instance:'}, {'account_id': 17799, 'date': '2018-02-14 21:09:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

The issue appears to be here https://github.com/openstack/ansible-hardening/blob/295ef13395a2edf1922b0d5a31f224fdf4b0b525/meta/main.yml#L7

(master branch should currently require min version 2.4)

If you are using 2.1, the stable/newton branch CI runs on  2.1: https://github.com/openstack/ansible-hardening/blob/dc602dbf42cb6685052f74313877e1dd40b8fb41/meta/main.yml#L7

stable/ocata also states 2.1 support, but the tests run on ansible 2.2 for that branch so YMMV: https://github.com/openstack/ansible-hardening/blob/f07bb96deb67c396e060342f4b2ee67b1d2652f1/meta/main.yml#L7'}, {'account_id': 167, 'date': '2018-02-14 21:18:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

This line is also wrong, yes.

According to the reverted commit message the include_tasks task is usable with Ansible 2.1+. Because of that I mentioned Ansible 2.1+ in the commit message. The include_tasks task was introduced with Ansible 2.4.

I think the current master should not only be usable with 2.4. Ansible 2.3 should be supported at least until the final release of Ansible 2.5.'}, {'account_id': 167, 'date': '2018-02-14 21:19:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

This is the commit message of the reverted commit: "This patch uses the new import_tasks/include_tasks modules from Ansible 2.1+ and removes some deprecation warnings from the beginning of playbook runs."'}, {'account_id': 538, 'date': '2018-02-15 13:59:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

I can get behind this for compatibility reasons. However, we may need to figure out a better way to version this role.'}, {'account_id': 167, 'date': '2018-03-02 11:02:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

how to proceed?'}, {'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2018-03-03 12:25:55.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

@Christian Is there a specific reason why you aren't happy using the stable/pike branch or any of the releases from it? That series is specifically built for Ansible 2.3 and should have the same feature set."}, {'account_id': 23517, 'date': '2018-03-03 12:31:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2018-04-03 07:56:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

I am curious, what prevents you from using another branch, which actively gets backports?'}, {'account_id': 167, 'date': '2018-05-18 08:35:59.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

meanwhile, this change is no longer relevant for us'}]

"include_tasks" is a new task in Ansible 2.4+, not in Ansible 2.1+.

This reverts commit 74c904247fb8ad69848db41408df0c812826915d.

Change-Id: I61348b8c606cb770863bd37883ea1eeed43e4be4

commit_message:
Revert "Use import/include_tasks"

"include_tasks" is a new task in Ansible 2.4+, not in Ansible 2.1+.

This reverts commit 74c904247fb8ad69848db41408df0c812826915d.

Change-Id: I61348b8c606cb770863bd37883ea1eeed43e4be4

commit_message:
Collect network interface metrics from all up interfaces with telegraf

By default inputs.net will collect metrics from all up interfaces, excluding
loopback.

Change-Id: Ib13b8c73ef14a0917f5aebc780f6ea5360f96a78
